name: Chicken Recipe
transcript:
# **licken Breasts Diane**

an ever pepular dish. Try this version with chicken breasts, tly pounded for an ateresting variation.

# Poultry at **Its Best**

Preparation time: 20 min.

- 4 large boneless chicken breast halves or 8 small
- $\frac{1}{2}$  tsp. salt

**IERICAN** 

- 1/4 to 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 2 Tbsp. olive or salad oil
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 3 Tbsp. chopped fresh chives or green onions Juice of 1/2 lime or lemon
- 2 Tbsp. brandy or cognac, optional
- 3 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 2 tsp. Dijon-style mustard
- 1/4 cup chicken broth

#### Tips:

You can pound chicken breasts flat and leave flattened between sheets of plastic wrap. Wrap them airtight in one package and freeze for later use.

### **Preparation:**

1 Place chicken breast halves between sheets of waxed paper or plastic wrap. Pound slightly with mallet. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper.

2 Heat 1 tablespoon each of oil and butter in large skillet.

8 Cook chicken over high heat for 3 minutes on each side. Do not cook longer or they will be overcooked and dry. Transfer to warm serving platter.

4 Add chives or green onion, lime juice and brandy, if used, parsley and mustard to pan. Cook 15 seconds, whisking constantly.

5 Whisk in broth. Stir until sauce is smooth. Whisk in remaining botter and oil.

6 Pour sauce over chicken. Serve immediately.

## Good served with:

Noodles with tomato sauce, steamed broccoli and a fresh salad.

name: Mac 'n' Cheese Recipes
transcript:
#### Classic Mac 'n' Cheese Prep: 20 minutes Cook: 20 minutes Serves: 6 to 8

Cook 6 oz. Ronzoni Elbow Macaroni according to package directions, drain. Bring 1 (10-oz.) container refrigerated light alfredo sauce, 2/3 cup chicken broth and 1 tsp. dry mustard to a boil. Reduce heat and stir in 11/2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, a little at a time, stirring until cheese is melted, then stir in macaroni. Transfer to a greased 9-inch baking dish. Stir together 1/4 cup panko bread crumbs and 3 tbsp. grated or shredded Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle over top and broil for 5 minutes or until top is golden brown.

## Mediterranean Mac 'n' Cheese

Prep: 15 minutes Cook: about 40 minutes total Serves: 6

Prepare pasta and sauce according to Classic Mac 'n' Cheese recipe above, using 1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese and 1/2 cup cubed fresh mozzarella cheese. Stir in 1/2 cup each: chooped man nated artichoke hearts and chopped Mezzetta Pitted Bistro Blend Olives. Top and broil as directed above

### Mac 'n' Cheese Italiano

Prep: 20 minutes Cook: 45 minutes total Serves: 6 to 8

Prepare pasta and sauce according to Classic Mac 'n' Cheese recipe above, using 1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese and 1/2 cup shredded fontina cheese. Stir in 1/2 cup each: chopped sundried tomatoes and chopped prosciutto and 1 tsp. dried basil. Top and broil as directed above.

# Bacon and Swiss Mac 'n' Cheese Prep: 20 minutes Cook: 30 minutes total Serves: 6

Prepare pasta and sauce according to Classic Mac 'n' Cheese recipe above, using 1 cup shredded Gruyère or other good CLIARTY Swiss cheese and 1/2 cup shredded sharp Cheddar Chronic Stir in 1/2 cup crisp bacon pieces and 1/2 tsp. dried

transcript:
**CORN BREAD** (Makes 12 servings) 1 cup ALBERS Yellow Corn Meal 1 cup all-purpose flour 1/4 cup granulated sugar 1 tablespoon baking powder teaspoon salt cup milk 1/3 cup vegetable oil 1 egg, lightly beaten **COMBINE** cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in medium bowl. Combine milk, oil and egg in small bowl; mix well. ADD milk mixture to flour mixture; stir just until blended. Pour into greased 8-inch-square pan.

BAKE in preheated 400°F. oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm. NOTE: Recipe may be doubled. Use greased 13 x 9-inch pan; bake as above. ## **SWEETER CORN BREAD VARIATION:**

**COMBINE** 1/2 cup cornmeal, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 2/3 cup granulated sugar, 1 tablespoon baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt in medium bowl. Combine 1/3 cup oil, 3 tablespoons melted butter or margarine, 2 eggs and 1 1/4 cups milk in small bowl. Combine as above. Pour into greased 8-inch-square pan. Bake in preheated 350°F. oven for 35 minutes.

## Cooked Jam Directions

Lids and jars must be sterilized. To sterilize the jars and lids, simmer them in botting water for at least 10 minutes while your jam or jelly is cooking.

1 Use dry measuring cup to measure exact amount of prepared fruit, ladle, 2 large bowls. or use liquid measuring cup to measure exact amount of prepared juice, into large saucepan. SURE-JELL For Less or No Sugar Needed Premium Fruit Pectin in small bowl. Stir into fruit Add 1/2 tsp. butter or margarine to reduce foaming, if desired. 4 Bring mixture to full rolling boil (a boil that doesn't stop bubbling when stirred) on high heat, stirring constantly. 5 Stir in remaining sugar. Return to full rolling boil and boil exactly 1 min., stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Skim off any foam with metal spoon. 6 Ladie immediately into prepared jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of tops. Wipe jar rims and threads. Cover with two-piece lids. Screw bands tightly. r Flace jars on elevated rack in canner. Lower rack into canner. (Water must cover jars by 1 to 2 inches. Add boiling water, if needed.) Cover; bring water to gentle boil. Process jellies 5 min. or process jams 10 min., adjusting processing time if necessary as directed in Altitude Chart. Remove jars and place upnoht on a towel to cool completely. After jars cool, check seals by pressing centers of lids with finger. If lid springs back, lid is not sealed and refrigeration is necessary. Let prepared jars stand at room temperature 24 hours (or for length of time indicated on recipe). Store unopened jams and jellies in cool, dry, dark place up to 1 year. Refrigerate opened jams and jellies up to 3 weeks.

name: Rosette Cookies Recipe
transcript:
- . To Fry: Place approximately 2" of oil in deep fryer or saucepan. Heat to 375". Securely attach two molds to handle and immerse in hot oil until thoroughly heated. Lift iron out and shake off excess oil (or blot on paper toweling). Dip iron into batter only to the depth of the molds. Avoid getting batter on top of molds. Immerse molds into hot oil, covering completely. When foamy bubbling stops, or Rosettes are a delicate brown, lift iron out, allowing excess oil to drip back into fryer. To remove Rosette, gently tap on top of mold with a wooden spoon. Before making additional Rosettes, reheat iron as necessary. (Iron must be hot!)
- If excess batter adheres to top of mold, fry as usual, then gently remove excess with knife for easier release.
- If batter will not adhere to molds, oil may be either too hot or too cold. Check with thermometer and adjust accordingly.
- If first Rosette Cookies are not crisp, thin batter with a little milk. Also check the temperature of oil and molds.
- Cool, with the more open side down, on rack or paper towelling.
- To store: Layer cooled cookies nor more than 3 deep in air-tight container. May be frozen.

No need to defrost before serving. If needed, recrisp in 300° oven 3-5 minutes.

The following recipes apply to these Instant Cookie and Patty Shell Sets:

- #01426 All Seasons Set
- #01306 Deluxe Rosette/Timbale Set
- #01300 Rosette Set
- #01402 Form Rosette Set
- #01305 Tom Thumb Bite Size Set

## **Rosette Cookies**

2 eggs, slightly beaten 2 tsp. sugar 1 cup milk

1 cup sifted flour 1/4 tsp. salt 1 Tbsp. lemon extract

Add sugar to eggs, then add milk. Sift flour with salt. Stir into egg mixture and beat until smooth (about consistency of heavy cream). Add flavoring. Fry and cool as directed. Makes approximately 45-50 Rosettes.

When cool, or before serving, sprinkle with confectioner's sugar, or cinnamon-sugar combination. Serve with either side of cookie face up.

\*In place of lemon extract, flavor with vanilla, brandy, anise, or rum extract.

## **Rosette Crackers**

For delicious hors d' oeuvres, salad, or soup accompaniment; or use the Bunny and Elephant forms to make "Animal Crackers".....

2 eggs, slightly beaten 1 tsp. garlic, onion, or celery salt or a combination of seasonings

V. tsp. salt 1 cup milk 1 cup flour

To slightly beaten eggs add seasoning, milk and flour. Beat until smooth.

Fry as "To Fry" instructions. Makes approximately 45-50 Crackers. Sprinkle with Kraft American Cheese Food or Parmesan Cheese.

name: Egg Recipes
transcript:
Eggehilada: Scramble eggs and spoon down the center of a tortilla. Roll up the tortilla, top it off with enchilada sauce and a drift of sour cream. Scatter some green onion on for a finishing touch. Simple and centsible.

The Prairie Dog: Fry an egg sunnyside up and, while it's frying, toast a split English muffin half and grill a split frank. Layer it all with a slice of cheese and then enjoy.

The Eggburger: Scramble an egg or two, or fry them over easy, then serve on a burger bun. Top with your choice of the workscheese, mushrooms, lettuce, tomato, onion, bacon, catsup, olives, almost anything. A mansized meal for mini-money.

Quiche: follow a basic recipe and vary it anyway you like. The greatest thing about a quiche is that it is a perfect vehicle for leftovers. You can use chopped cooked chicken, fish, ham, or almost any shredded cheeses. Or chopped cooked vegetables such as green beans, carrots, broccoli, asparagus, cauliflower,  $potatoes -$ 

The possibilities are endless.

name: Sour Cream Pralines

## SOUR-CREAM PRALINES

Sour cream gives these pralines extra richness

1-1/2 cups granulated sugar 1-1/2 cups packed brown sugar 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon baking soda I cup sour cream I tablespoon light corn syrup 2 tablespoons butter or margarine I teaspoon vanilla 2 cups pecans Combine sugars, salt, baking soda, sour cream and corn syrup in large heavy saucepan. Cook over moderate heat to thread stage (230° on candy thermometer), stirring constantly. Remove from heat and beat in butter, vanilla and pecans. Cool to warm, then beat until mixture begins to lose its sheen. Working rapidly to prevent candy from setting, drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. If candy begins to set. return to heat or put pot in bowl of boiling water until mixture is soft and smooth. When set and cool, remove pralines to a tray. Makes about 36.

name: Mushroom Recipes
transcript:
# Mushrooms for all seasons

Add an elegant accent to dining with a fresh mushroom appetizer or salad course. You can serve it anytime because a ready supply of fresh mushrooms is available yearround. When selecting mushrooms, look for caps tucked down close to the stems. Keep mushrooms lightly covered in the refrigerator for up to two days. Before using, rinse the mushrooms and pat dry. Cut off the stem ends.

### **HERBED STUFFED MUSHROOMS**

1 pound large fresh mushrooms, about 11/2 inches in diameter

Lemon juice

- 2 3-ounce packages cream cheese, softened
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened
- tablespoon snipped parsley
- tablespoon snipped chives

Lettuce leaves **Pitted ripe olives Prosciutto ham Cherry tomatoes** 

With small, sharp knife cut stem out of each mushroom, leaving a smooth cavity. (Refrigerate and save stems for another use.) Coat mushrooms with lemon juice; let dry on paper toweling. In mixer bowl combine cream cheese,

**Buying information, page 160** 

## teaspoon fines herbes

butter or margarine, parsley, chives, and fines herbes; beat with electric mixer till light and fluffy. Fill mushroom cavities with cream cheese mixture; sprinkle tops with additional snipped parsley, if desired.

Arrange mushroom caps on lettuce lined salad plates; add ripe olives, prosciutto, and cherry tomatoes. Makes 8 appetizer servings.

### **LEMON-MARINATED MUSHROOMS** pound fresh mushrooms

- 1/2 cup olive or salad oil
- tablespoons lemon juice
- tablespoon Dijon-style mustard
- $1/2$  teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper

### **Lettuce leaves**

Cut mushrooms in 1/8-inch slices. In screw-top jar combine olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper. Cover jar and shake well. Pour mixture over mushrooms, tossing gently to coat. Let mixture stand at room temperature for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Serve mushrooms on lettuce leaves. Makes 3 or 4 salad servings.

name: Planters Peanut Cheese Ball
transcript:
## **Plant some Planters** in some Cheddar cheese.

Crumble 4 oz. blue cheese, and mix well with 4 oz. finely grated Cheddar cheese, 3 oz. cream cheese, 2 tablespoons chopped parsley, and 1/2 teaspoon grated onion. Shape into a ball, wrap, and refrigerate until firm. Reshape ball and roll in chopped Planters Dry Roasted Peanuts.

transcript:
In heavy 2-quart saucepan combine chopped chocolate, half the whipping cream, and margarine. Cook and stir over low heat 10 minutes or till chocolate melts. Remove from heat; gradually stir about half the hot mixture into beaten yolks. Return yolk mixture to pan. Cook and stir over medium heat 2 minutes more or till thickened; remove from heat. Stir in remaining cream.

Chill about 1 hour or till mixture is completely cool and smooth, stirring occasionally; transfer to Small Mixing Bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed 2 minutes or till slightly fluffy. Apply Seal; chill 15 minutes or till mixture holds its shape. For each truffle, drop a heaping tablespoon of the mixture onto a waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Chill 15 minutes or till firm. Do not overchill. Roll each mound into a 11/2-inch ball. Chill 20 minutes more.

name: Szechuan Beef Recipe
transcript:
## **SZECHUAN BEEF** (Easy Cooking)

Makes 4 servings.

- 1 flank steak (about 1 pound)
- 1/4 cup bottled chili sauce
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon dry sherry
- 1 teaspoon cornstarch
- 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- 3 tablespoons peanut or vegetable oil
- 3 cloves garlic, smashed
- 1 small bunch green onions, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1. Put flank steak on a small cookie sheet; freeze for 15 minutes to "firm up" for easier slicing. Then cut steak in half lengthwise. Cut each half into  $\frac{1}{8}$ -inch slices.
- 2. Mix chili sauce, soy sauce, sherry, cornstarch, ginger and red pepper flakes in a small bowl; reserve.
- 3. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in wok or large skillet. Add garlic and green onions; stir-fry 1 minute. Remove to a bowl with slotted spoon.
- 4. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil to wok. Add steak slices, a third at a time, and stir-fry quickly until meat loses its red color. Place in bowl with green onions.
- 5. Add chili sauce mixture to wok; heat until bubbly-hot. Stir in meat and green onions; cook and stir until chili sauce mixture coats meat and green onion.

Go-with's: Frozen won ton soup, hot cooked rice, canned kumquats and pineapple chunks.

Generously grease bottom and sides of 13x9-inch baking pan. In large mixing bowl, soften yeast in warm water. (No need to sift flour; measure by lightly

# Jeef'n bean roll-ups

#### Winner in Pillebury's 21st Pake Off

## Winner in Pillsbury's 21st Bake Off

spooning into cup and leveling off.) Add 1 cup flour, sugar, salt, shortening, milk and egg to dissolved yeast; mix well. Stir in remaining flour to form a stiff dough. Knead on floured surface until dough is smooth and no longer sticky, about 3 minutes. Place in greased bowl, turning to grease top. Cover; let rise in warm place until light and doubled in size, 1 to 11/2 hours. Punch down dough. Roll out on floured surface to 18x12-inch rectangle. Brush with 2 tablespoons reserved peach syrup; sprinkle dry gelatin over lengthwise half of dough. Randomly spoon peaches over gelatin. Fold plain half over peach half; seal edges. Cut into twelve 11/2-inch strips. Twist each strip 2 times. Place in prepared pan, forming 2 rows of 6 twists each; press both ends of each strip firmly to bottom of pan. Cover; let rise in warm place until light and doubled in size, 30 to 45 minutes. Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown. Prepare Topping; pour warm Topping over warm twists. Serve warm or cool.

Topping: In small saucepan, combine all ingredients. Bring to a boil; boil 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.

\*For use with Pillsbury's Best Self-Rising flour, omit salt.

name: Fruited Pork Recipe
transcript:
## **Fruited Pork**

Prepare in: 2 quart Casserole/Cover

- V<sub>2</sub> cup water
- V<sub>4</sub> cup cider vinegar
- 2 tablespoons light molasses
- tablespoon soy sauce Dash pepper
- Ib. boneless pork loin roast, cut into
  - $2 \times$  V<sub>4</sub>-inch strips
- medium apple, coarsely chopped
- V<sub>4</sub> cup chopped walnuts
- V<sub>4</sub> cup raisins
- can (11 oz.) mandarin oranges (reserve 1/4 cup juice)
- 6 teaspoons cornstarch
  - Hot cooked rice

In 2 quart Casserole/Cover mix water, vinegar, molasses, soy sauce and pepper. Microwave at High for 1 to 11/2 minutes, or until hot, stirring after half the time. Stir in pork. Cover. Refrigerate for about 1 hour. Drain pork, reserving 2 tablespoons marinade. Set aside reserved marinade. Place Casserose with pork on Micro-Go-Round\* in Missigways oven. Microwave at 70% Statesburn Feight) for 3 to 6 minutes, or until pork is no longer pink. Drain, reserving liquid. Add apple, walnuts and raisins. Microwave at 70% (Medium-High) for 2 to 3 minutes, or until apples are tender. Stir in oranges. Coverand set aside.

In small mixing bowl, blend reserved marknade, reserved cooking liquid and 14 cup mandarin orange juice. Add cornstarch. Mixwell. Microwave at High for 2 to 3 minutes, or until thickened, stirring 3 or 4 times. Stir into pork mixture. Serve over rice.

To prepare in advance and freeze: Follow recipe above, except do not drain cooked pork, and add reserved marinade to pork with apple, walnuts and raisins. Do not microwave this mixture. Cover and freeze in 2 quart Casserole Cover for up to 2 months. To defrost, microwave frozen mixture at 70% (Medium-High) for 11 to 17 minutes, or until heated through, breaking apart and stirring 2 or 3 times. Drain liquid into small mixing bowl. Set aside. Stir oranges into casserole. Cover. Add 14 cup mandarin orange juice to reserved cooking liquid. Add cornstanch. Mixwell. Continue as directed. Serves 4 to 6

transcript:
**TACO QUICHE** Filling: 8 corn tortillas (soft) 2 lbs. lean ground beef 1 purple Spanish onion. chopped 1 clove garlic, pressed 1 teaspoon chili powder <sup>1</sup>4 teaspoon EACH: ground cumin, thyme, salt <sup>1/2</sup> teaspoon oregano 1 lb. shredded Monterey **Jack cheese** Custard: **6eggs** 2 cups milk Toppings: 1 small head lettuce, shredded 2 tomatoes, sliced

1lar avocado, sliced  $\frac{1}{2}$  pint sour cream olives for garnish chili salsa, optional

Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease an extra large quiche dish (or a 9"x13" pan or two 9" pie pans). Line with tortillas, tearing them to fit, if necessary. Brown ground beef and onion, then add spices. Pour into pan(s). Top with shredded cheese. Beat eggs and milk together and pour over all. Bake approximately 1 hour or until custard is set. While still warm, spread sour cream, then tomatoes and avocados, ending with lettuce and olives. Pass the salsa. Serves 8.

transcript: MULLED CHRISTMAS WINE 1 lemon 10 whole cloves **Cinnamon** sticks 1/2 cup sugar 1 bottle (4/5 quart) dry red wine (Burgundy, for example) Using a sharp knife, cut peel off lemon in a continuous spiral. Remove spices and peel with slotted spoon and discard. Add wine and lemon juice to water and heat until steaming. Serve hot in mugs with cinnamon sticks as stirrers. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

name: Limoncello Recipe
transcript:
## Limoncello Liqueur

Prep: 30 minutes Cook: about 5 minutes Stand Time: 1 week, plus 1 day Makes: 9 cups

- lemons, scrubbed with a vegetable 16 brush under running water
- (750-ml.) bottles 80 proof vodka  $\boldsymbol{2}$ 
  - (the cheaper the better!)
- $\bf{3}$ cups sugar
- cups water 3

**1.** Pat lemons dry and remove peel with a vegetable peeler, being careful not to include any of the white pith. (Scrape any off with a paring knife, as it will make the liqueur bitter.) 2. Place peels and vodka in clean containers with resealable tops; cover and let sit at room temperature for 1 week. 3. Bring sugar and water to a boil in a medium saucepan; let boil for about 5 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Let cool to room temperature. Remove peels from vodka and add sugar mixture to taste. (Save any remaining for another use.) Pour into clean, decorative bottles. Will keep in the refrigerator or freezer for up to 3 months.

Nutrition per serving (51 g): 80 calories, 0 g protein, 0 g total fat (0 g sat., O g trans), 10 g carbohydrate, 0 g fiber, 9 g sugar, 0 mg cholesterol, 0 mg sodium, 1 point

name: Cranberry Pie Recipe
transcript:
## Cranberry pie

**ACTIVE 25 MIN (NOT** INCLUDING DOUGH MAKING) TOTAL 1 HR TO MIN (PLUS COOLING) + SERVES 10 **COST PER SERVING 896** 

- 4 cups whole cranberries, fresh or unthawed frozen
- 1/2 cup plus 2 tsp sugar
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
- 21/2 tsp cornstarch
- tsp orange zest
- 1/4 tsp kosher salt Pinch freshly ground nutmeg Flour, for the surface
- 1 recipe double-crust ple dough (2 disks; recipe, page 95)
- Tbsp unsalted butter, cut into small pieces

## Double-crust pie dough

ACTIVE IS MIN . TOTAL I HR IS MIN **MAKES I DOUBLE CRUST (2 DISKS) COST PER DISK SLIS** 

In a large bowl, combine 21/2 cups plus 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour. A tsp salt and 1/2 cup each unsalted butter (cut into small pieces) and rendered leaf lard or shortening. Using your hands, rub the butter and lard into the flour until it resembles cracker crumbs with lumps the size of peas and almonds. Sprinkle 1/4 cup ice water over the mixture and stir lightly with a fork. Squeeze a handful of dough to see if it holds together; if not, add more water, I tsp at a time, until it does. Divide the dough in half and shape into two 5-in. disks. Wrap tightly in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to 3 days.

large egg white Vanilla ice cream, for serving

Place 3 cups of the cranberries in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until they are slightly chopped. Transfer to a medium bowl and toss with the remaining 1 cup whole cranberries. Add 1/2 cup sugar, walnuts, cornstarch, zest, salt and nutmeg and gently mix. On a lightly floured surface, roll out 1 disk of dough into a 12-in. round. Fit into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-in. pie plate. Spoon the cranberry mixture into the prepared crust and dot with the butter. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the remaining disk of dough and cut out 8 large triangles. Place over the cranberry filling, leaving space between. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 1 day. Heat oven to 375°F. In a small bowl, lightly beat the egg white with 2 Tbsp water. Brush all over the pie, then sprinkle with the remaining 2 tsp sugar.

name: Basic Adobo Recipe
transcript:
Dear Kowolik,

Hello! It's me, Glenn Seavey, your Hawaiian Sales Consultant at Larry Genere Ford. As you probably know, I am originally from Hawaii. I love the food and the culture and would like to share this love with you. The recipe below for Basic Adobo is one of my favorites. It is a Phillipino dish that is very easy to make and "ono" good.

Basic Adobo Ingredients: 3 1b. chicken thighs or 3 1b. pork butt 1/2 cup vinegar 1/4 cup soy sauce 3 cloves of garlic 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon peppercorns, crushed 1 bay leaf, crushed Cut chicken pieces in half if thighs are large. If using pork, cut into 1 1/2 inch pieces. In a saucepan, combine all ingredients. Let stand for 1 to 3 hours. Bring to a boil. Cover, lower heat, and simmer for 30 minutes (45) minutes for pork). Remove cover and simmer 15 more minutes or until liquid evaporates and chicken/pork is lightly browned. Makes 6 servings.

I would recommend preparing some white rice as a side dish. Please call me after you prepare this dish and tell me what you think... or just bring a little by so I can sample your version. Enjoy!

Sincerely, Glenn Seavey Larry Geweke Ford  $530 - 821 - 2121$

name: Krispie Treats Recipe
transcript:
## **ICE KRISPIES** FREATS RECIPE

- 3 Tablespoons margarine or butter
- Package (10 oz., about 40) regular marshmallows or 4 cups miniature marshmallows
- 6 Cups KELLOGG'S<sup>®</sup> Rice Krispies® cereal

## **Directions:**

1. Melt margarine or butter in large saucepan over low heat. Add marshmallows and stir until completely melted. Remove from heat.

2. Add KELLOGG'S® Rice Krispies® cereal.

Stir until well coated.

3. Using a buttered spatula or waxed paper, press mixture evenly into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Cut into 2-inch squares when cool. Best if served the same day.

## **Microwave Directions:**

In a large microwave-safe bowl, heat margarine or butter and marshmallows on HIGH for 3 minutes, stirring after 2 minutes. Stir until smooth. Follow steps 2 and 3 above. Microwave cooking times may vary.

## Note:

. For best results, use fresh marshmallows. +1 jar (7 oz.) marshmallow creme can be substituted for marshmallows. Diet, reduced calone or tub. margarme is not recommended.

name: Lemon Bars
transcript:
## Base:

- 1 1/4 cups C&H® Granulated **Cane Sugar**
- **1 Butter Flavor\* Crisco® Stick** or 1 cup Butter Flavor Crisco All-Vegetable Shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup light corn syrup or regular pancake syrup
- 3/4 teaspoon baking powder 1/2 teaspoon baking soda 1/2 teaspoon salt Topping: 5 eggs Grated peel of one lemon 1/2 cup lemon juice 2 cups C&H Granulated Cane Sugar

## **LEMON BARS**

1 tablespoon vanilla 3 cups all-purpose flour 1/3 cup all-purpose flour 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder

Heat oven to 350°F. Grease 10 x 15-inch pan with shortening. Place cooling rack on countertop for cooling cookies.

For base, combine C&H Granulated Cane Sugar and shortening in large bowl. Beat at medium speed of electric mixer until well blended. Add eggs, syrup and vanilla. Beat until well blended and fluffy. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add gradually to creamed mixture at low speed. Mix until just blended. Spread dough into bottom of prepared pan in an even layer. Bake 7 to 10 minutes, or until light brown.

For topping, combine eggs, lemon peel, lemon juice, sugar, flour and baking powder in large bowl. Beat until well blended. Spread over partially-baked base. Return pan to oven. Bake at 350°F for an additional 10 to 15 minutes, or until topping is set. DO NOT **OVERBAKE.** Place pan on cooling rack. Cool 10 minutes in pan.

name: Bourbon Brownies
transcript:
## DOUBLE-FROSTED BOURBON **BROWNIES**

It's best to make a double batch and freeze what's left-they disappear fast! Bake at 325° for 30 minutes. Makes about 3 dozen squares.

- 3/4 cup sifted all-purpose flour
- V<sub>A</sub> teaspoon baking soda
- V<sub>4</sub> teaspoon salt
- $\frac{1}{2}$  cup sugar
- V<sub>3</sub> cup vegetable shortening
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 package (6 ounces) semisweet chocolate pieces
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 eggs
- 11/2 cups coarsely chopped walnuts 4 tablespoons bourbon White Frosting (recipe follows) Chocolate Glaze (recipe follows)
- 1. Sift flour, baking soda and salt onto wax paper.
- 2. Combine sugar, shortening and water in a medium-size saucepan. Heat, stirring constantly, until sugar melts and mixture comes to boiling. Remove from heat; stir in chocolate pieces and vanilla until smooth.
- Beat in eggs, one at a time. Stir in  $3.$ flour mixture and walnuts. Spread evenly in 9x9x2-inch greased pan.

name: Brandy Fruit Potpourri
transcript:
## **RED BRANDIED FRUIT POTPOURRI**

Also known as tutti-frutti, fruit crock or romertopf. Start this add-to potpourri when the first fruit of spring or summer is available. As other fruits come in season, add them to the crock. Mixture will take several weeks to develop. It is very important to use only perfect, firm, ripe fruits; to wash and dry them well; to sterilize the crock and let the mixture ferment in a cool, dry place (not in the refrigerator or in a hot kitchen). This potpourri makes a sweet sauce that's delicious on ice cream, plain cake or puddings.

- I cup fresh plums, peeled and sliced 4 cups sugar, divided
- I cup brandy

## 1 cup sliced strawberries 1 cup blueberries 1 cup raspberries

Sterilize gallon crock or large glass jar in boiling water. Drain, then add plums, 1 cup sugar and the brandy; stir well. Cover with cheesecloth and let stand in cool, dry place overnight. Next day or as berries are available, stir in one of the suggested berries and 1 cup sugar. Cover with cheesecloth and return to cool storage place. The next few days repeat with remaining berries, adding I cup sugar with each. When all berries are added, cover with cheesecloth and store in cool, dry place at least 2 weeks, preferably I month, or until fermented. Every 3 to 4 days stir up sugar from bottom of crock to be sure it dissolves. When sufficiently fermented (mixture will have a sweet brandied flavor), place air-

## McCALL'S COOKING SCHOOL

1 Make streusel mixture. In small bowl, combine light-brown sugar, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 tablespoons flour and the cinnamon; mix with fork until crumbly. Makes 1 cup. Set aside. With sharp knife, coarsely chop apricots and prunes; toss to combine.

2 Grease well and ligh ly flour a 10-inch tube pan. Preheat oven to 350F. Make coffeecake batter: On a sheet of waxed paper, sift together 3 cups flour, the baking powder, baking soda and salt, set aside. Turn % cup butter into the large bowl of electric mixer.

3 At medium speed, best until fluffy. Gradually beat in granulated sugar, then eggs, one at a time. Beat until very light and fluffy-about 3 minutes, occasionally scraping the bowl with a rubber scraper. Add vanilla extract. Divide flour mixture into four parts.

5 Turn one third of batter into prepared pan, spreading evenly. Sprinkle with one third of streusel mixture. Repeat layering of remaining batter and streusel mixture twice. Bake 55 to 60 minutes, until cake tester inserted in center comes out clean. 4 At low speed, beat in flour mixture (in fourths) alternately with sour cream (in thirds), beginning and ending with flour mixture. Beat just until smooth-about 1 minute. With rubber scraper, gently fold in the prunes and apricots just until combined.

6 Let cool in pan on wire rack about 20 minutes. With spatula, carefully loosen edge of coffeecake from side of pan. Remove from pan to platter. Sift confectioners' sugar over top of coffeecake. Serve warm. Makes 10 servings. (This freezes very well.)

name: Chicken Chimichangas Recipe
transcript:
## **Chicken Chimichangas** with Green Sauce

- 210.5-ounce cans condensed cream of chicken soup
- 24.5-ounce cans diced green chilies
- 5 pitted green olives
- 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and chopped
- 2 Tbs. fresh lime juice from 1 lime

- 1/<sub>2</sub> of a 1.25-ounce package taco seasoning
- 1 pound shredded, cooked chicken meat (about 3 cups)
- 8 10-inch flour tortillas
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 18-ounce package shredded sharp cheddar cheese
- 18-ounce package cream cheese, softened
- 18-ounce package shredded **Monterey Jack cheese**
- 1 cup chopped green onions (about 1 bunch)
- 18-ounce container sour cream

Pour the cream of chicken soup into a blender along with the green chilies, olives, jalapeño pepper and lime juice. Purée until smooth, then pour into a saucepan and warm over medium-low heat.

Next, in a large bowl, mash together the cream cheese, Monterey Jack cheese and taco seasoning until well blended. Stir in the chicken. Evenly divide mixture among the 8 tortillas, placing filling in center of tortilla. Fold top down, fold bottom up, then roll up sides to make a square packet.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium to mediumhigh heat. Fry 4 chimichangas at a time, seam side down, until golden brown, about 90 seconds; flip with tongs and fry other side an additional 90 seconds. Drain on a plate lined with paper towels. To serve, place a chimichanga on a plate, and ladle the warm pepper sauce over top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and green

name: MCP Pectin Recipes
transcript:
# Special
Recipes from **MCP®PECTIN** KRAFT GENERAL FOODS, INC. WHITE PLAINS, NY 10625, U.S.A. Any questions? Call 1-800-431-1001 9-4 (EST) M-F (cont. U.S.) ### **Pancake and Waffle Syrup** Follow the directions on the recipe folder in the MCP Pectin package for making any jelly, adding 1 /2 teaspoons baking soda (level, packed) to the juice and MCP Pectin in the kettle. Stir until foaming subsides. Bring to a boil. Add the specified amount of sugar, and bring to a full rolling boil (a boil that cannot be stirred down). Boil for 2 minutes. Skim foam. Pour into sterilized jars. Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 year. ## **Ice Cream Topping** Follow the directions on the recipe folder in the MCP Pectin package for making any jam, adding 1% teaspoons baking soda (level, packed) to the fruit and MCP Pectin in the kettle. Stir until foaming subsides. Bring to a boil. Add the specified amount of sugar, and bring to a full rolling boil (a boil that cannot be stirred down). Boil for 4 minutes. Skim foam. Pour into sterilized jars. Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 year. #### Microwave Jam and Jelly Guidelines (Yield: One-half the amount of the original recipe) - 1. Use one-half of the amounts called for in the recipe folder inside the pectin box. (One-half package of MCP Pectin measures 21/2 tablespoons.) - 2. Sift sugar before measuring to break down any lumps that may not dissolve during cooking. Measure sugar into dry bowl to be added later. - 3. Measure fruit or juice into 3- or 4-quart glass bowl. Add lemon juice if called for. - 4. Stir the MCP Pectin into fruit or juice, and microwave on high until mixture boils throughout (about 8-9 minutes). Stir midway through cooking time. - 5. Quickly stir in premeasured sugar. Mix well. Add 1/8 teaspoon margarine to reduce foaming. - 6. Microwave on high until the jam or jelly tests done (about 7-8 minutes). To determine doneness, use one of the tests listed below. - 7. Skim foam. Pour and seal according to directions on recipe folder. ## **Spoon or Sheet Doneness Test for Jellies** - Dip a cool metal spoon in the jelly mixture. Raise the spoon above the kettle and turn the spoon so the syrup runs off the side of the spoon. If the syrup forms two drops that flow together and fall off the spoon as one sheet, the jelly should be done. - Refrigerator Doneness Test for Jams Pour a small amount of hot jam on a cold plate, and place it on the top shelf of a refrigerator for 2-3 minutes. If - One misture jells, it should be done.

Cook's note: Leftover enchilada sauce and chili con carne can be frozen.

Procedure

Prepare chili con carne: Brown beef in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic powder, cumin and bay leaf and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, 15 minutes. Add a little water if pan becomes dry.

Add chili powder and water, stirring well, and bring to simmer. Simmer 10 minutes. Add beans, if using, and heat through. Remove bay leaf.

Prepare enchilada sauce: Heat oil in large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, until flour is browned (this mixture is called roux); be careful not to let flour burn. Stir in chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper, and cook, stirring constantly, two to three minutes. Gradually add water, stirring

minutes.

Assemble enchiladas: Heat oil in skillet. Dip each corn tortilla in skillet of hot oil to soften. Drain on paper towels. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

Mix 3 cups grated cheese with onion in large bowl. When tortillas are cool enough to handle, fill with cheese and onion mixture, and roll up. Place seam side down in 9-by-13-inch baking dish and cover with 2 cups enchilada sauce (see Step 3) and half of chili con carne. Top with remaining cheese.

Bake in preheated oven 10 minutes or until cheese melts.

name: Gingerbread Cookies
transcript:
## **Chocolate Gingerbread Boys and Girls**

- 2 cups (12-ounce package) NESTLE **TOLL HOUSE Semi-Sweet Chocolate** Morsels, divided
- 2% cups all-purpose flour
  - teaspoon baking soda
  - 1/2 teaspoon salt
  - 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
  - 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon

- 3 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened
- 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1/<sub>2</sub> cup molasses
- X cup water
  - Prepared vanilla frosting or colored icing in tubes

1% cups leasp

- 1/<sub>1</sub> leasp
  - $c$
  - $50<sup>1</sup>$
- X cup
- X cup
- 2 leas
- $2$  egg

Microwave 1/2 cups morsels in medium, microwave-safe bowl on HIGH (100%) power for 1 minute; stir. Microwave at additional 10- to 20second intervals, stirring until smooth. Cool to room temperature.

Combine flour, baking soda, salt, ginger and cinnamon in medium bowl. Beat butter and granulated sugar in small mixer bowl until creamy. Beat in molasses and melted chocolate. Gradually add flour mixture alternately with water, beating until smooth. Cover and chill for 1 hour or until firm.

Roll half of dough to 1/4-inch thickness on floured surface with floured rolling pin. Cut into gingerbread boys and girls, using cookie cutters or a stencil. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Repeat with remaining dough.

Bake in preheated 350°F. oven for 5 to 6 minutes or until edges are set but centers are still slightly soft. Let stand for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Place remaining morsels in heavy-duty plastic bag. Microwave on HIGH (100%) power for 45 seconds; knead. Microwave at additional 10-second intervals, kneading until smooth. Cut a small hole in corner of bag; squeeze to pipe over cookies. Decorate with piped frosting or icing. Makes 21/2 dozen cookies.

name: Fish Recipes
transcript:
## **BAKED SOLE FILLETS IN WINE SAUCE**

- 1 Lb. sole fillets, fresh or frozen
- 2 Tbs clarified butter, or salad oil
- 2 This finely minced onion
- 2 Tbs flour

- W. HOD SAIL
  - Pinch white pepper
- 1 Cup light cream or milk
- heated
- V<sub>2</sub> Cup white wine

Defrost frozen fillets in their package. Wipe fish with a damp cloth, cut into serving portions, and arrange in a layer in a well-buttered baking dish. Heat the oil over medium heat and saute the onion to a golden translucence. Stir in the flour and conk and stir until smoothly blended and bubbly. Add the salt and pepper, and in a slow and steady stream, stir in the cream, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat and slowly stir in wine until blended. Pour the sauce over the fish. Bake in a preheated 350°F, oven for about 1/2 hour or until the flesh flakes to a fork. Spoon the sauce from the pan over the fish from time to time, keeping it well distributed over the fish.

## **BAKED FISH FILLETS**

- 2 Lbs. fillets
- Cup mushrooms, sliced  $\frac{1}{2}$ Salt and pepper
- 2 tsp lemon juice V<sub>4</sub> Cup Monterey Jack cheese, grated 1/4 Cup bread crumbs 1/<sub>2</sub> Cup melted butter

- tsp marjoram
- 2 Scallions, chopped
- 2 Tbs dry white wine

Butter a baking dish and sprinkle the scallions and mushrooms on the bottom. Arrange the fish fillets over the vegetables, covering the thin part of each fillet with the thick part of another (to prevent overcooking). Season the fish and sprinkle with wine and lemon juice. Top with cheese and bread crumbs and pour butter over top. Wrinkle a piece of waxed paper, wet it, and spread it directly on the fish. Bake at 400° for 7 minutes. Remove waxed paper and bake 5 minutes longer. Serves 4-6.

## **RED SNAPPER WITH CAPERS**

- 2 Lbs. large red snapper fillets or steaks
- 2 Tbs flour
- 2 Tbs cornmeal
- tsp salt
  - Pepper **Milk**

- Ths cooking oil
- Tbs capers
- 2 Medium ripe, firm tomatoes,
  - peeled and sliced
- $\frac{1}{4}$  Cup red wine

Wipe the fillets with a damp cloth. Combine dry ingredients. Dip the fillets in the milk and dredge in the flour and cornmeal mixture. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet and quickly brown the fillets on both sides. Reduce the heat. Arrange half of the capers on the fish, cover with tomato slices, and put the remaining capers on top. Salt and pepper generously. Add wine to the pan. Cover and cook over medium heat for about 20 minutes, or until flesh flakes to a fork. Move to a serving platter. Serve immediately. garnished with additional capers.

name: Strudel Recipe
transcript:
Strudel making can be fun, especially if you invite some helpers to come over and join in the doughstretching. Follow these easy steps, and you'll be able to bake a flaky, fruit-filled strudel any European pastry maker would envy!

## **BASIC STRUDEL**

- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup butter or margarine
- beaten egg
- <sup>35</sup> cup warm water (110° to 115°)
- 34 cup butter or margarine, melted
- 1 recipe Apple or Walnut-Raisin **Filling**

of dough over filling. Slowly and evenly lift cloth beneath filling, rolling dough into tight roll. Seal ends. Step 5: Place on lightly greased

large baking sheet; curve slightly to form crescent. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.

Step 6: Brush tops of strudels with beaten egg white. Bake in 350° oven for 40 to 45 minutes. Remove from pan; cool on rack. Sift powdered sugar over tops. Makes 2 strudels.

## beaten egg white **Powdered sugar**

Step 1: Stir together flour and salt; cut in the  $\frac{1}{2}$  cup butter or margarine till crumbly. Mix together beaten egg and water; add to flour mixture. Stir well. Turn onto lightly floured surface; knead 5 minutes. Divide dough in half. Cover; let stand at room temperature 1 hour. Cover table, at least 3 feet square, with a clean, floured sheet or tablecloth. On the sheet roll half the dough to a 15-inch square. Brush with 2 tablespoons of the melted butter; let stand, covered, 10 minutes.

Step 2: Starting from middle of the square, carefully work underneath dough, using backs of hands to gently stretch till dough is paper thin and about 30 inches square.

Step 3: Trim uneven edges of 3/4 cup candied orange peel dough. Brush dough with  $\frac{1}{4}$  cup of **1/4 cup sugar** the melted butter. Beginning 4 inches in from one side of dough, spoon half the desired filling in a band about 4 inches wide across dough. Step 4: Using sheet as a guide, gently lift and fold the 4-inch piece

## **APPLE FILLING**

- <sup>3/3</sup> cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 6 cups very thinly sliced peeled tart apples (about 6 medium)
- $\frac{1}{2}$  cup dried currants

In bowl combine sugar and cinnamon; mix well. Add apple and currants; toss gently to mix. Use half the filling for each strudel.

## **WALNUT-RAISIN FILLING**

- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine 1½ cups soft bread crumbs (2) slices bread)
- 11/2 cups chopped walnuts 11/<sub>2</sub> cups raisins
- *M* cup apricot jam, sieved

In small skillet over medium heat, melt butter or margarine. Add bread crumbs. Cook, stirring occasionally, till crumbs are golden brown. Remove from heat. Stir in walnuts, raisins, jam, orange peel, and sugar. Use half the filling for each strudel.

## Choc-Oat-Chip Cookies

- 1% cups all-purpose flour
  - teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt (optional)
- 11/4 cups packed light brown sugar
  - cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
  - 1/2 cup granulated sugar

- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 21/2 cups quick or old-fashioned oats
  - 2 cups (12-ounce package) NESTLÉ **TOLL HOUSE Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels**

Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Beat brown sugar, butter and granulated sugar in large mixer bowl until creamy. Beat in eggs, milk and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in oats, morsels and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.

Bake in preheated 375°F. oven for 9 to 10 minutes for chewy cookies or 12 to 13 minutes for crispy cookies. Let stand for 1 minute; remove to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

name: Pulled Pork Recipe
transcript:
## $\int$ classics $\int$

Get ready for tailgating season with this classic from our archives, requested by Virginia Bergman of Roseville. California.

Do you have a favorite recipe you'd love to see again? Let us. know. See page 4 for details.

## **Pulled Pork**

Prep time: 15 minutes Cook time: 1 hour 40 minutes

(4-lb.) boneless pork shoulder roast large onion, chopped

## tbsp. oil

- cup orange juice
- 1/2 cup ketchup
- tbsp. brown sugar 3
- tbsp. red wine vinegar 3
- 21/<sub>2</sub> tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- tsp. liquid smoke 1
- 1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper
- cloves garlic, chopped 3

## **Sandwich rolls**

Cut pork into cubes, discarding any large pieces of fat. Cook pork and onion in oil over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add remaining ingredients except rolls and stir well. Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 1 hour. Remove cover and cook over medium heat for 30 minutes or until most of the liquid has cooked off. Shred pork using 2 forks or a potato masher. Spoon onto warm rolls and serve. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Nutrition per serving (based on 7): 760 calories, 58 g protein, 33 g total fat (12 g sat.), 55 g carbohydrate, 3 g fiber, 175 mg cholesterol, 1000 mg sodium, 17 points

name: Spiced Walnuts
transcript:
## **SPICED WALNUTS** (Mexico)

Bake at 300° for 10 minutes. Makes 3 cups.

- 1/4 cup vegetable oil

Spicy nut nibbles for the cocktail hour.

2 teaspoons chili powder 1/<sub>2</sub> teaspoon ground cumin 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric

**Pinch cayenne** 3 cups walnuts 1/<sub>2</sub> teaspoon salt

1. Combine oil, chili powder, cumin, turmeric and cayenne in a skillet. Heat over low heat until oil is quite hot (do not let oil smoke). Remove from heat. 2. Add walnuts to oil; stir until coated. Spread walnuts in a paper towel-lined shallow baking pan. 3. Bake in slow oven (300°) 10 minutes, or until crisp. Sprinkle with salt. Cool; pack in fancy jars; seal.

name: Fruit Cocktail Cake
transcript:
FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE (From Texas Christian University)

Preheat oven to 325°.

1 16-oz. can fruit cocktail (use juice in cake) 2 cups all-purpose flour  $1\frac{1}{2}$  cups sugar 2 teaspoons soda 2 eggs Pinch salt % cup brown sugar  $\frac{1}{2}$  cup chopped nuts Sauce: 1 stick butter

 $1\frac{1}{2}$  cups sugar 1 small can evaporated milk Fruit from can

Drain fruit juice from fruit cocktail. Mix flour, sugar, soda, eggs, salt and juice together. When well-mixed, pour in wellgreased and floured flat pan (13x9x2-inch). Put 3/3 cup brown sugar and chopped nuts on top. Bake 45 minutes. Meanwhile, bring sauce ingredients to a boil. When cake is done, punch holes; pour sauce over.

name: Stuffed Cabbage

name: Icecap Avocado Dressing Chicken Salad
transcript:
## It's a Cool Breez With California Iceberg Lettuce and **California Avocados**

The just-right respite. Light, extra-crunchy chicken salad, splashed with chilly Avocado Dressing. It all comes together on a bed of icy Iceberg Lettuce. Take a minute and make it up. It's too hot to not!

## **Icecap Avocado Dressing leeberg Chicken Salad**

2 ripe California Avocados. peeled and mashed 1/2 cup sour cream V<sub>3</sub> cup mayonnaise  $2\frac{1}{2}$  to 3 tsp. lemon juice 1/4 tsp. dill Dash of salt

Combine avocado and lemon juice until well blended. Add sour cream, mayonnaise, dill and salt. Stir until creamy. (yield: 2 cups)

1 head California Iceberg Lettuce, washed and shredded (reserving four large leaves) 2 cups chicken, cooked and diced 1 cup celery, sliced

2½ to 3 Tbsps. green onion, finely chopped 1 ripe California Avocado, halved, peeled, and sliced into 12 crescents

Toss chicken, celery and onion together. Place a lettuce leaf on each of the four salad plates. Arrange shredded lettuce on each leaf. Mound chicken salad in center of each shredded lettuce bed. Garnish each serving with three avocado crescents and top with Icecap Avocado Dressing. Serves 4.

any food gift. It is both a courtesy and a safety measure, since any food or ingestible may hold some risk for triggering an allergic reaction.

To make a homemade liqueur gift more special, include a set of cordial glasses. They will be a subtle reminder that liqueurs should be consumed in small amounts. A few sips (about 1 ounce) in a miniature goblet is an appropriate serving for these sweet drinks.

You might also include a food gift and recipe that use the liqueur. As an example, we've adapted a simple pound cake recipe for holiday gift-giving.

Who knows, if your homemade gifts are a hit this season, you may want to plan for next year and take advantage of summer's bounty to brew up some blueberry, peach or raspberry liqueurs.

2 c. whole mushrooms 2 c. watercress 2 T. butter or vegetable oil V<sub>3</sub> c. soy sauce 2 T. sugar Cooked rice

name: Broccoli & Water Chestnut Salad
transcript:
## **BROCCOLI WITH WATER CHESTNUTS SALAD**

There is no frozen chopped broccoli or fresh broccoli in China. The Chinese use a green vegetable quite similar to broccoli in this recipe, which the housewife has to parboil, cool and chop.

Makes 4 servings at 20¢ each.

| package (10 ounces) frozen |  |  |
|----------------------------|--|--|
| chopped broccoli           |  |  |

- 10 water chestnuts, finely minced
  - 1 tablespoon pimiento, cut into small squares
  - 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  - 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- $\frac{1}{2}$  teaspoon sugar
  - Liquid red-pepper seasoning to 1/2 teaspoon, according to taste

1. Thaw and drain broccoli. Make sure all the pieces are finely chopped. Mix with minced water chestnuts. In a bowl mix soy sauce, oil, sugar and red-pepper seasoning.

2. Five minutes before you are ready to serve, pour sauce over broccoli. Toss to blend ingredients. Sprinkle pimiento over the salad. At the table, mix again before serving.

name: Zucchini Chocolate Cake Recipe
transcript:
## Chocolate Zucchini Cake

- 2-1/2 cups regular all purpose flour (unsifted)
- $1/2$  cup cocoa
- 2-1/2 tsp. baking powder
- $1 1/2$  tsp. soda
  - tsp. each salt, cinnamon
- $3/4$ cup soft butter or margarine
  - cups sugar
    - eggs

 $\overline{c}$ 

 $\overline{c}$ 

- tsp. each vanilla, grated orange peel
- cups coarsely shredded zucchini
- cup milk  $1/2$ 
  - cup chopped pecans or walnuts

Combine the flour, cocoa, baking powder, soda, salt, and cinnamon. Set aside. With a rotary mixer beat together the butter and sugar until they are smoothly blended. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. With a spoon, stir in the vanilla, orange peel, and zucchini. Alternately stir the dry ingredients and the milk into zucchini mixture, including the nuts with the last addition. Pour into a greased and floured 10 inch tube pan or bundt pan. Bake in a 350°F. oven for about 1 hour or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 15 minutes. Turn out on wire rack to cool thoroughly. Drizzle glaze over cake. Cut in thin slices to serve. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

Glaze: Mix together 2 cups powdered sugar, 3 thl. milk, and I tsp. vanilla; beat until sumoth.

name: Cherry Swirl Cake
transcript:
CHERRY SWIRL CAKE 1 pkg. Pillsbury Plus White Cake Mix 3 egg whites 1 cup water  $\frac{1}{3}$  cup oil 21-oz. can cherry fruit filling Whipped topping if desired Heat oven to 350°F. Generously grease and lightly flour 13x9-inch pan. In large mixer bowl, blend first four ingredients until moistened. Beat 2 minutes at highest speed. Pour into pan. Reserve 1 cup cherry fruit filling for topping. Spoon remaining cherry fruit filling over cake batter; gently swirl through batter to marble. Bake at 350°F. for 35 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool. Spread reserved cherry fruit filling over cake. Top with whipped topping if desired. Makes 13x9-inch cake. HIGH ALTITUDE - Above 3500 Feet: Add 3 tablespoons flour to dry cake mix. Increase water to 11/4 cups. Bake at 375°F, for 30 to 40 minutes.

Most regreables, from asparagus to mechini, can be dehydrated at home. Select garden fresh, top-quality produce for the best results. Remember, although dried regerables retain most of their vitamin and mineral content and good flavor, the original quality cannot be improved.

All vegetables require some preparation, such as removing stems, peelor seeds, before drying. Like fruits, uniformly cut slices or pieces result in even drying. Unlike fruits, regetables are better out slightly smaller to hasten drying time. Vegetables lose flavor and tenderness if the drying time is prolonged. Drying time varies from about 4 to 14 hours. A temperature of 125°F is recommended for most vegerables. Finished vegerables should contain about 5% moisture. When tested, regetables should look and feel crisp or brittle.

Vegetables can be eaten dried, but they are usually reconstituted

If a vegetable is not listed in the following pages, freezing or canning may be a more suitable method of food preservation.

Pack dehydrated vegetables in home canning jars, plastic jars, plastic storage containers or vacuum package. Label and date.

#### Asparagus

Choose young, tender stalks. Wash: cut off tough end. Slice into 1-inpieces. Steam blanch 3 to 4 minutes. Dry at 125°F until brittle. Rehydrate and serve in soups or with seasoned cream sauce. Water content 92%.

## Beans-Green Or Wax

Choose any variety with crisp, thick walls and small seeds. Wash: off ends; cut diagonally into 1-inch pieces or French cut to expose more surface area. Steam blanch 4 to 6 minutes. Freeze beans 30 minutes tenderize; dry at 125°F until brittle. Rehydrate and use in cassere soups and stews. Water content 90%.

#### Beets

Choose any variety with deep-red color and smooth skins. When remove all but one inch of stem and tap root. Steam about 30 min. or until tender. Cool; peel; trim stem and tap root. name: Roasted Garlic Recipe
transcript:
When garlic is roasted, it becomes mild and soft enough to spread over bread or crackers. For additional herb flavor, place a sprig of fresh thyme over the cut surface of the garlic before roasting. Roasted garlic can also be used to flavor cream of potato soup. Simply roast as directed. When cool, squeeze Preparing Garlic
For Roasting the garlic from the skin into the soup and puree the entire mixture. One whole head or bulb of garlic will flavor 6 to 8 quarts of soup. Roasted Garlic 4 whole garlic heads 1/3 cup water 1/4 cup olive or vegetable oil Sliced French or Italian bread Cut the top off of each garlic head (the end that comes to a closed point) so that each clove is exposed. Place with cut side up in a small ungreased baking dish; pour water around garlic. Cover and bake at 350° for 1 hour or until garlic is very soft. Cool for 5 minutes. Slowly drizzle oil into the center and over each garlic head. Remove soft garlic from skins; spread on bread or over cooked meats or vegetables. Yield: 4-6 servings. transcript:
## Chocolate-Dipped Brandy Snaps

- V<sub>2</sub> cup (1 stick) butter
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup dark corn syrup
- 1/<sub>2</sub> teaspoon ground cinnamon
- V<sub>4</sub> teaspoon ground ginger
- cup all-purpose flour

- 2 teaspoons brandy
  - cup (6 ounces) NESTLE TOLL HOUSE Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels
  - tablespoon shortening
- 1/3 cup chopped nuts

Melt butter, granulated sugar, corn syrup, cinnamon and ginger in medium saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat; stir in flour and brandy. Drop by rounded teaspoon about 3 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets, baking no more than 6 at a time. Bake in preheated 300°F. oven for 10 to 14 minutes or until deep caramel color. Let stand for a few seconds. Remove from baking sheets and immediately roll around wooden spoon handle; cool. Microwave morsels and shortening in small, microwave-safe bowl on HIGH (100%) power for 45 seconds; stir. Microwave at additional 10- to 20-second intervals, stirring until smooth.

Dip each cookie halfway into melted chocolate mixture, pushing mixture up onto cookie with a spatula; shake off excess. Sprinkle with nuts; place on waxed-paper-lined baking sheets. Chill for 10 minutes or until chocolate is set. Store in airtight containers

## in refrigerator. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

name: Chicken Tortilla Soup
transcript:
## chicken tortilla soup

**SERVES4** 

**TOTAL: 15 MIN ACTIVE: 15 MIN** 

- corn tortillas, halved, then cut crosswise in narrow strips
- cans (14.5 oz each) chicken broth
- medium zucchini, cut in 3/4-in.-thick half-rounds
- tsp each minced garlic and ground cumin  $\frac{1}{2}$ 
  - cup corn
- can (16 oz) red kidney beans, rinsed
- 1<sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cups large shreds cooked chicken
  - large ripe tomato, cut in 1-in. chunks
- $1/2$  cup chopped cilantro

1. Coat a 5- to 6-gt pot or Dutch oven with nonstick spray; heat over medium heat. Add tortilla strips and cook 5 minutes, turning occasionally, until lightly toasted. Remove to a paper towel or plate.

2. Add broth, zucchini, garlic and cumin to pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 3 minutes, or until zucchini is crisp-tender.

3. Stir in tortilla strips, corn and beans; continue to simmer 2 minutes until tortillas soften. Stir in remaining ingredients; heat through.

Per serving: 309 cal, 26 g pro, 36 g car, 8 g fiber, 6 g fat (1 g sat fat), 47 mg chol, 730 mg sod

name: Zucchini Cookie Recipes
transcript:
## Zucchini cookies? Why not

Course shreds of fresh zucchini squash and bits of dried fruit make these whole. come cookies extra moist and chewy.

You can choose spicy drop cookies made. from granola-type cereal, or glazed bar. cookies. When tightly wrapped in clear. plastic film, they will keep up to a week. in your cooky jar.

## Lucchini-Granola Jumbles

Beat together until creamy 34 cup softened butter or margarine and 11/2 cups firmly packed brown sugar. Add I egg and I teaspoon each vanilla and grated. orange peel; beat until blended.

In a small bowl, blend together I cup allpurpose flour (unsifted), 1 teaspoon each salt and soda, and 3 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice; add to creamy mixture and beat until well blended. Gradually stir in 1/2 cup each chopped dried apricots and raisins, 1 cup chopped nuts, 3 cups granola-type cereal, and 2 cups unpared, coarsely shredded zucchini.

Drop level tablespoonfuls of the batter 3 inches apart on greased cooky sheets. Bake in a 375° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until richly browned. Transfer to racks to cool. Makes about 6 dozen cookies.

## **Fruit and Zucchini Bars**

Beat together until creamy 3/4 cup softened butter or margarine and  $\frac{1}{2}$  cup each firmly packed brown sugar and granulated sugar. Add 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla; beat until blended.

In a small bowl, blend together 13/4 cups all-purpose flour (unsifted),  $\frac{1}{2}$  teaspoon salt, and  $1\frac{1}{2}$  teaspoons baking powder; gradually add to creamy mixture and beat until well blended. Stir in 3/4 cup each shredded coconut, snipped dates, and raisins, and 2 cups unpared, coarsely shredded zucchini. Evenly spread the mixture in a greased 10 by 15-inch jellyroll pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean and top is richly browned. Place on a rack to cool slightly.

Beat together until well blended and smooth 1 tablespoon melted butter or margarine, 2 tablespoons milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1 cup powdered sugar. Drizzle over warm bar cookies, spreading evenly; sprinkle 1 cup finely chopped walnuts on top. Cool thoroughly before cutting into bars. Makes about 4 dozen, G. I., Priest Lake, Idaho.

transcript:
1⁄4 cup butter or fortified margarine **K** cup enriched flour My teaspoon salt I cup milk

## Cheeses Service

12 pound package sharp, spreading cheese 4 well-beaten egg yolks 4 stiff-beaten egg whites

Melt butter in double boiler; add flour and salt: blend. Add milk and stir constantly until sauce is thick and smooth. Add sliced or diced cheese to the hot white sauce. Cover. Let stand over boiling water until cheese is soft. Beat egg yolks with rotary beater; add the blended cheese sauce slowly. Beat the egg whites until stiff but not dry, and turn them into the bowl with the cheese-sauce mixture. onion Few grains salt, pepper

Stud fat edge of ham with cloves. Place in baking dish; add cider. Combine sugar, mustard; sprinkle over ham. Cover. Bake in moderate oven (350°F.) 25-30 min. per lb. Drain off liquid. name: Chicken Alfredo Recipe
transcript:
## Ingredients

- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 6 boneless, skinless chicken-breast halves (about 4 ounces each)
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil, divided
- 3 cloves garlic, minced

## Creamy Chicken Alfredo

Preheat oven to 375°F. Place flour in a shallow. dish or pie plate. Sprinkle chicken with salt; coat with flour. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add chicken; cook, turning once, until golden, 2-4 minutes per side. Remove chicken from skillet; place in a 13- x 9-inch baking dish.

Heat remaining L olive oil in same skillet over medium heat until hot. Add garlic and onion; cook until garlic is fragrant and onion is tender, 1-2 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high; add whipping cream, Parmesan and pepper. Cook until sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes. Spoon sauce over chicken in dish.

- 1 tablespoon minced onion
- 1<sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cups whipping cream
  - 1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese
  - 1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper
    - 1 tablespoon coarsely chopped fresh parsley

makes 6 servings

step 1

step 2

Bake chicken until an instant-read thermometer inserted in center of chicken registers 180°F, 8-12 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

transcript:
3 to 3 1/2 cups Pillsbury BEST™ Bread Flour 2 teaspoons sugar 1/2 teaspoon salt 1 (1/4 oz.) packet active dry yeast

1 cup warm water (120 to 130°F)

2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

STIR flour, supar, salt and yeast in large bowl. Add warm water and oil. Mix well. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes, adding additional flour as necessary. Coat large bowl with no-stick cooking spray. Place dough in bowl, turning to coat top. Cover toosely with plastic wrap. Let rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 30 to 40 minutes. SPRINKLE baking sheet with commeal. Punch down dough. Shape dough into oval-shaped loaf, about 12 inches long. Place on prepared baking sheet. Coat loaf lightly with cooking spray. Cover loosely with plastic wrap. Let rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 30 to 45 minutes. HEAT oven to 375°F. Make a 1-inch deep lengthwise slash in top of loaf using a serrated knife. Brush loaf with egg white. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until loaf sounds hollow when lightly tapped. Makes 1 loaf (16 servings)

name: Bonnie Yogurt Recipes
transcript:
## Notés from Bonnie Yogurt: A Kitchen Staple

## For Great Dishes In Fast Style

Fast is better only if the results live up to expectations. With yogurt in your refrigerator, you can turn out interesting dishes in a matter of minutes which meet the criteria of delicious, lowfat, low cholesterol foods.

Think of yogurt as a staple in your kitchen to blend with many herbs, spices, condiments, sweeteners and convenience products for flavorful, pleasurable eating. The following formulas will give you some ideas.

 $1/2$  cup yogurt  $+1$  tsp. cornstarch = thickener for cooked sauces 1 cup yogurt + 1 tsp. mustard = mayonnaise alternative (salt  $\&$ pepper to taste) 1 cup yogurt + 2 tbsp. all-purpose flour = cream base for hot soups  $1/2$  cup yogurt + 2 tbsp. ricotta cheese = base for dips 1 cup yogurt + 1 pkg. instant pudding mix = creamy dessert  $1$  cup yogurt + 2-3 tsp. fruit spread = dessert topping 1 cup yogurt + 1 cup sweetened rhubarb (layered) = refreshing dessert 1 cup yogurt +  $1/2$  cup chutney = dip for fresh fruit  $1/2$  cup yogurt  $+1$  tsp. prepared horseradish = topping for burgers, ham or chops

name: Meringue Cake Recipe
transcript:
# Meringue Cake with Nuts, Cream, and Berries **From Eivor**

#### Cake

- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 1 % dl sugar or 2/3 cup
- 4 egg yolks
- 1 1/<sub>2</sub> tsp, baking powder
- 1 1/<sub>2</sub> flour dl or 2/3 cup
- 5 tbsp half and half or milk  $\bullet$

# Meringue

- 4 egg whites
- 2 dl sugar or 3/4 cup
- 1/<sub>2</sub> tsp baking powder

### **Filling if desired**

- Nuts over cake batter before meringue
- . Whipped cream sweetened with powdered sugar and vanilla or vanilla sugar
- **Berries**

# **Directions**

- 1. Turn oven on to 425 degrees but lower to 325 when cake is ready to put in.
- 2. Mix room temperature butter and sugar. Add the egg yolks one at a time while beating with mixer. Mix baking powder and flour and then add to egg mixture alternating with milk.
- 3. Beat the egg whites to the hardest foam possible. Mix baking powder and sugar together then carefully mix into the egg mixture.
- 4. Line a baking pan with parchment paper all of the way up the sides (I used a jell roll pan). Brush the paper with butter. Spread the cake batter over the entire surface. It will seem thin. If adding nuts spread them at this time. Cover the batter with the meringue mixture.
- 5. Bake about 25-35 minutes but take out to check that the cake is done under the meringue.
- 6. Let cake cool. Cut in half and put together with cream, berries etc.

name: Tamale Pie Casserole & Com Bread Mexicana
transcript:
# Tamale Pie Casserole

(Makes 4 to 6 servings)

### Crust

- 1 1/4 cups ALBERS Yellow Corn Meal
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 11/2 cups (12-ounce can) undiluted **CARNATION Evaporated Milk**
- 1 oup water

1 pound ground beef 1 clove gartic, minced 1 cup diced onion 1/4 cup diced green bell pepper  $1$  cup (8.3/4-ounce can) cream-style com 1/2 cup (2 1/4-ounce can) sliced olives, drained 1 cup (8-ounce can) **CONTADINA Tomato Sauce** 1 tablespoon chili powder

- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 1/3 cup shredded cheddar cheese

For Crust: COMBINE com meal, salt, evaporated milk and water in small saucepan; cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, for 5 to 7 minutes or until thick. Remove 1/2 cup, cover with plastic wrap. Spread remaining com meal mixture on bottom and sides of preased 8-inch square baking dish (let cool 2 to 3 minutes if necessary). Bake in preheated 425°F, oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven.

For Filling: BROWN ground beef, garlic, onion and bell pepper in large skillet; drain. Add corn, olives, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt and pepper, mix well. Spoon into com meal crust. Drop rounded teaspoons of remaining corn meal mixture on top of meat, sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven and bake for 15 minutes.

## Com Bread Mexicana

(Makes 12 servings) 4 tablespoons butter or margarine, melted, divided 1/4 cup finely diced onion 1/2 cup (4-ounce can) diced green chiles 2 tablespoons diced pimento 1 cup canned, drained or frozen corn 11/2 cups ALBERS Yellow Corn Meal 1/2 cup all-purpose flour 1 tablespoon baking powder 1 teaspoon salt 1/2 cup (2 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese 2/3 cup undiluted CARNATION **Evaporated Milk** 1/3 cup water

POUR 1 tablespoon butter into medium skillet; add onion, green chiles and pimento. Sauté for 3 to 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add corn; cook for 1 minute.

**COMBINE** corn meal, flour, baking powder, salt and cheddar cheese in medium bowl; mix well. Combine remaining melted butter, evaporated milk, water and egg in small bowl; mix well. Add milk mixture and sautéed vegetables to flour mixture; stir just until blended. Pour into well greased 8-inch square pan.

BAKE in preheated 400°F, oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Variation: INCREASE cheese to 1 cup (4 ounces), evaporated milk to 1 cup and water to 1/2 cup. Prepare as above. Pour into well greased 9-inch square pan and bake as above.

1 egg, lightly beaten

### **Hush Puppies**

(Makes about 14 hush puppies)

- 1 1/4 cups ALBERS Yellow Corn Meal
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1/2 cup finely chopped onion
- 3/4 cup *undiluted* CARNATION **Evaporated Milk**
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 egg, lightly beaten

**COMBINE** corn meal, flour, salt, baking soda, black pepper, cayenne pepper and onion in medium bowl.

**COMBINE** evaporated milk, lemon juice and egg in small bowl; add to corn meal mixture and mix just until blended.

HEAT 2 to 3 inches of vegetable oil in 2 to 4-quart saucepan to 350°F. Drop batter by rounded tablespoon into hot oil; turn to brown evenly. Cook for about 3 minutes or until golden brown. Remove with slotted spoon; drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.

For Cheesy Hush Puppies: ADD 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp cheddar cheese to batter; mix well.

name: Almond Brittle Recipe
transcript:
## Crispy Almond Brittle

The texture of mut brittle is determined by the proportion of its ingredients: The more sugar, the harder the brittle; the more butter, the softer the brittle. Use a metal spatula to spread the mixture quickly (it hardens very fast) and evenly onto a baking sheet lined with lightly oiled baking parchment. Cut the brittle into pieces before it has hardened completely. To make the diamond-shaped pieces shown, cut the almond brittle diagonally in one direction and then cut parallel to the narrow edge of the pan. Store the brittle in an airtight tin in a cool place; it will

keep for 6-8 weeks.

## SWEDISH MEATRALLS

1 pound ground lean beef 1/2 pound each

- lean pork and veal, ground
- 1 cup dry stalebread crumbs
- 1 cup milk
- 1 onion, minced Butter
- 2 eggs, beaten Dash each
  - nutmeg, pepper

- I teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons **MONAT**
- 2 cups meat stock or consomme Pinch of grated
- lemon rind 1 cup dairy sour
- cream Chopped dill or parsley Cooked noodles

Blend meats, crumbs and milk. Sauté onion in 1 tablespoon butter and add to meat with eggs and seasonings. Mix with hands to get even texture; roll in small balls. Brown in 2 tablespoons butter. Remove meatballs. To pan juices, add flour and stock to make gravy. Stir until hot. Check seasoning and add lemon rind. (Gravy should not be too thick at this point.) Return meatballs to gravy and simmer over very low heat 1 hour. Remove meatballs to serving dish with slotted spoon. Stir sour cream into gravy and heat. Pour over meat; add dill. Serve with noodles. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

name: Boston Baked Beans
transcript:
## **Best of the Best: BOSTON BAKED BEANS**

NEW ENGLANDERS say there's no finer eating than Boston Baked Beans, sweet with molasses and spiced with a hint of pork and savory onion. But-this may come as a surprise-the real Yankee version of this bean dish is never simmered stove-top! It's made with soaked beans, baked in the oven and moistened with warm water.

That's exactly the way it's done at Boston's famous Durgin-Park Restaurant, founded in 1742 and known by its motto: "Good food on the table and plenteous portions." Here, there's a special cook just for the beans. He's the 1. Soak beans overnight in a large bow in the 6 cups water. Place beans with soaking water in a large lettle ald baking soda; bring to boiling fower heat and continue to boil for 10 minutes. Drain in colander over large bowl. reserving liquid.

2. Place salt pork, onion and reans in a 2-quart bean pot or casserole. Combine molasses, sugar, dry mustard, pepper and 1 cup of the reserved liquid. Pour over beans, stir thoroughly. Add just enough reserved liquid to cover bears (about I cup). Cover casserois. 3. Bake in a slow oven (300°) for 2 hours. Add remaining 1 cup liquid and stir thoroughly. Continue baking an additional 11/2 to 2 hours or until beans are tender and liquid is alsorbed. Bake

**Directions:** 

Warm the milk to body temperature (98 degrees). Pour it over the yeast in a bowl. Stir until the yeast is dissolved. Add 1/3 cup of the white syrup and a little less than 4 cups of the flour. Beat it in a mixer until it is smooth and a rather loose dough. Cover it with a towel and let it rise for at least 30 minutes. It will double in size.

Dot the butter into the batter and mix it. Beat the egg and add the rest of the syrup, the egg and the salt and the cardamom. Finally add the rest of the flour. Beat it all together into a smooth dough.

Turn dough onto floured board. Divide the dough into 30 pieces and roll each one into a ball.

Cover two cookie sheets with baking paper and put the balls on the sheets, fifteen on each. Let them rise for 45 - 60 minutes.

Combine center crumbs with almond paste and some milk or cream. Filling should be quite loose. Divide filling among rolls. Whip cream and divide among rolls. Return tops and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Filled buns should be eaten the day they are made. Plain buns can be frozen 3 - 6 months. It is possible to use purchased almond paste in the filling. name: Neiman Marcus Cookie Recipe
transcript:
NEIMAN MARCUS \$250.00 COOKIE RECIFE A friend of a friend had lunch at the Hedges at Neiman Marcus in November, and for dessert she had a cookie. She thought it was the most wonderful cookie she had ever tasted and asked if the recipe was available. She was told that it was but there was a charge of two-fifty. She said that was fine, got the recipe and told them to just charge her account.

In December when she got her bill, there was a charge of \$250.00. She called and told them there was a mistake. that the charge should be \$2.50. She was told there was NO mistake--that the charge was correct. They told her it was not a returnable item and she would have to pay the amount charged to her account of become delinquent in her payments.

The bottom line is, she paid. She has vowed to get them back, and wants to get the recipe out to everyone she possibly can, and asks that everyone who gets a copy send it to everyone they know. So here it is: 2 cups butter 2 cups sugar 2 cups brown sugar 4 eggs 2 teaspoons vanilla 4 cups flour \*5 cups blended oatmeal. 1 leus poon sal! 2 Ieaspoons baling powder 2 teaspoons baking soda 4 ounces chocolate chips 18-ounce Hershey Bar, grated 3 cups of chopped nuts Blended natmeal; Measure and blend in a blender to a fine powder. name: Homemade Ricotta
transcript:
## DIY) Fresh Ricotta

It's amazingly simple to make-just three ingredients. and less than a half hour required—and it's more delicate than store-bought fresh ricotta. Plus, it's only half the price! Use this rich, fluffy cheese for lasagna, cannoli, or simple crostini (with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil or topped) with chopped fresh herbs). Dieters: See the reduced-fat version, below.

## **Fresh Ricotta**

Active time 5 minutes Total time 25 minutes plus standing Makes 15 ounces or about 2 cups

- Cheesecloth\*
- 8 c. whole milk
  - **Salt**
- 3 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice

1. Line large strainer with 4 layers cheesecloth and place lined strainer in large bowl; set aside.

2. In heavy-bottom 4-quart saucepan, heat milk and I teaspoon salt to boiling on medium-high, stirring occasionally to prevent milk from scorching.

3. Stir in lemon juice; cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. With slotted spoon, gently transfer curds from saucepan to lined strainer. Drain 3 minutes. Discard whey in bowl. 4. If not using right away, transfer ricotta to clean bowl, cover, and refrigerate up to 1 week.

**EACH TABLESPOON** About 25 calories, 2 g protein, 0 g carbohydrate, 2 g total fat (1 g saturated), 0 g fiber, 8 mg cholesterol, 30 mg sodium.

Reduced-Fat Ricotta Substitute 4 cups reduced-fat (2%) milk for 4 cups whole milk, and follow recipe as above. Makes 15 ounces or about 2 cups.

**EACH TABLESPOON** About 25 calories, 2 g protein, 0 g carbohydrate, 1.5 g total fat (1 g saturated), 0 g fiber, 6 mg cholesterol, 30 mg sodium.

name: Aunt Patsy’s Recipes
transcript:
## STURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING

Rumor has it that the sturgeon general is a good bud of Aunt Patsy's (is there something fishy about this??) Together they have issued this warning. ALL OF THESE RECIPES WORK BETTER WITH AUNT PATSY'S OWN SPECIALTY **SHAPED PASTA** 

Many years ago, a Chinese man named Ah Li worked in an Italian restuarant in New York. He spoke neither English nor Italian. His job was to cook the pasta. The chef any years ago, a Grand Lesting the pasta until he could dent the nocelles easily when he bit into them. When you dentee, you called," he said. So Ah Li tested the incourse this way and when they were just right the had a natural nocelle knack), he would cry "Ah Li dentee! Ah Li dentee!" And the name stuck

### PASS-TA-SALAD

Aunt Patsy found (quite by accident, we're sure) that a few fresh ingredients. make a great pasta salad! It's so popular when she serves it everyone yells pass-talbalaz.

12 oz of your favorite Aunt Patsy's Pasta 1/2 cup olive oil 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice I to 2 oz fresh basil leaves chopped (the

#### **MAC AND CHEESE**

In the little town where Aunt Patsy lives, the local photographer is named Mac. Now Mac goes around saying "cheese" alot. Cousin David, Aunt Patsy's son, thought this was Mac's favorite dish!

- 12 oz of your favorite Aunt Patsy's Pasta I tablespoon Butter (yes, the real stuff) 1/2 teaspoon salt 2 teaspoons mustard
- 3 cups grated Cheddar Cheese (12 oz.)

#### **SOUPER MINESTRONE**

Sometimes Aunt Patsy doesn't have all the veggies listed below so she uses this recipe as a "must-go" dinner. She looks in the refridge and there's some veggies that. must-go so she dumps them in this soup. Use whatever veggies you can "dig-up."

3 tablespoons olive oil 2 cloves garlic (you really like garlic? use more!!) I cup chopped onion I cup chopped carrots 1/<sub>2</sub> cup chopped celery I chopped zucchini 8 oz lean ham, slivered (optional) I teaspoon basil leaves I teaspoon oregano leaves 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/<sub>8</sub> teaspoon pepper 1-15 oz can tomato sauce 1-14 oz can stewed tomatoes (undrained) 6 cups good quality chicken broth 1-151/4 oz can kidney beans, drained I cup shredded spinach or cabbage 1 cup (6 oz) pasta-your favorite Aunt Patsy's shape parmesan cheese

more the better!) or 2nd choice is 11/2 tablespoons dried basil 3 cups chopped very ripe tomatoes 1/2 cup parmesan cheese salt and pepper to taste

Cook the pasta according to instructions until al dente (remember what that means?) Drain and wildly toss with the olive oil and lemon juice. (If using dried basil throw it in now.) Cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally.

Add the chopped basil, tomatoes, salt and pepper. Mix gently (if you don't do this gently, you're gon'a destroy the noodles!).

Sprinkle the parmesan on top, garnish with basil leaves or parsley and voila . . . pass-ta-salad!

Note: For a dinner version add some chicken chunks!

egg, beaten (but not bruised) cup milk

Pour the whole concoction into a buttered baking dish. Mix the egg and milk together and pour over the top. Sprinkle with the rest of the cheese. Bake at 350° for about 45 minutes till bubbly and top is crusty. Smile and enjoy.

# 'VE GOT THE AUNT PATSY'S "DON'T FEEL LIKE COOKING' BLUES"

Just got home from the office Feelin' like limberger cheese Don't wanna do any cookin' Let me go out for fast food please . . . I've got the Aunt Patsy's "Don't Feel Like Cookin' Blues" Don't wanna work all day and at night be following Betty Crocker's clues ... to go! With this ole' everyday eight-to-five business I think I've paid my kitchen dues!

Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Now dump in the spinach (or cabbage) and the pasta. Simmer another 12 minutes or so until the pasta is tender.
